title.value: Sampling-Based Accuracy Testing of Posterior Estimators for General Inference
title.justification: This is the title of the research paper.
title.quote: Sampling-Based Accuracy Testing of Posterior Estimators for General Inference

extractions.description: The paper introduces 'Tests of Accuracy with Random Points' (TARP) coverage testing as a method to estimate the coverage probabilities of generative posterior estimators. The authors provide a theoretical framework and demonstrate the method on synthetic examples to show its effectiveness in high-dimensional spaces.

type.justification: The paper demonstrates its findings on a variety of synthetic examples and real-world applications.
type.quote: We demonstrate the method on a variety of synthetic examples, and show that TARP can be used to test the results of posterior inference analyses in high-dimensional spaces.

name.justification: The paper focuses on improving methods for posterior estimation using generative models in machine learning.
name.quote: Generative models can be used as an alternative to Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods for conducting posterior inference.

name.justification: The work is heavily focused on simulation-based inference methods and their validation.
name.quote: Simulation-based inference (SBI, e.g. Cranmer et al., 2020), also known as likelihood-free inference (LFI) or implicit likelihood inference (ILI), has gained significant popularity in recent years

name.justification: The paper aims to evaluate and validate posterior estimations using various generative models.
name.quote: The goal is this paper is to introduce a framework for testing the accuracy of parameter inference using only samples from the true joint distribution of data x and the parameters of interest θ, p(x, θ), and samples from the estimated posterior distribution p̂(θ|x).

name.justification: Neural Ratio Estimation (NRE) is one of the methods discussed as part of neural network-powered, amortized inference methods.
name.quote: but today SBI has evolved to encompass more powerful, neural network-powered, amortized methods, such as Neural Ratio Estimation (NRE)

is_contributed.justification: The model is used as an example but is not contributed by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: but today SBI has evolved to encompass more powerful, neural network-powered, amortized methods, such as Neural Ratio Estimation (NRE)

is_executed.justification: There is no explicit mention in the paper that it was executed within the study.

is_compared.justification: There is no numerical comparison provided between NRE and other models in the paper.
